item.title: Günther Förg | Max Hetzler and Luxembourg & Dayan
item.description: Günther Förg was a German painter with quite a forbidding aesthetic - grainy architectural photographs, often of buildings built for a Fascist government - and monochrome acrylic paintings on a lead backing. He’s also selling well, if the three commercial gallery shows of his work in London alone over the past few months are any guide. Two of them are running at the moment, one at Max Hetzler and one at Luxembourg & Dayan, and offer a good guide to both types.
